content.description: Training Pants is the second wide crack from the left on the Great Flake.  It would be lots of fun were it not so short.
content.protection:
Pro to 5"  2 bolt anchor up top.  Walk around to the back of the Great Flake to reach the top anchors.

If you're leading, be sure to place gear early to protect you and your belayer from tumbling down the slab.

content.description: Chimney/offwidth that requires a bit of pain. There are a few ledges inside that can be grabbed to help progress along.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor at the top. Bring wide pro if you're going to lead it.
content.location: Chimney to the left of Live and Learn. No rap rings at the top but it is possible to walk down off the backside with a little difficulty.

content.description: Fun crack that is a good first gear lead. The crux comes right off the ground but can be easily protected. The rest of the climb is a very fun and straight forward crack
content.location: Downhill and around the corner from unconquerable

content.description: Dan's Delight is the left-most crack climb on the Great Flake.  Its mosly fists and fun... but way too short.
content.protection:
Shares top anchors with 'Training Pants'  Takes cams up to 4 inches.

To reach the top anchors walk around either side to the back of the great flake and climb up.

content.description: Hard to start, but if you have good offwidth technique this will be a nice 5.8. If you don't have great technique, this will be a strenuous lieback climb that feel's like 5.10+
content.protection: Toprope anchor (2 bolts) accessible from the gully behind the Great Flake.
content.location: On the Great Flake, third crack from the left (or right).
